sen.j: 願証尼（がんしょうに、天暦7年（953年） - 長元7年8月25日 (旧暦)（1034年10月10日））は、平安時代中期の天台宗の尼僧。
sen.e: Ganshoni (953-October 16, 1034) was a nun (a Buddhist nun) of Tendai Sect in the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: 「長元7年8月25日 (旧暦)」＝グレゴリオ暦「西暦1034年10月16日」、出典：http://maechan.net/kanreki
sen.e: Ganshoni (953-October 16, 1034) was a nun (Buddhist nun) of the Tendai sect in the mid Heian period.
sen.cmt: made "Sect" lowercase; eliminated "a" in the parenthetical description as it felt unecessary
sen.e: Ganshoni (953-October 16, 1034) was a nun (Buddhist nun) of the Tendai sect in the mid Heian period.

sen.j: 父は卜部正親。母は清原氏。
sen.e: Her father was Masachika URABE.
Her father was Masachika URABE and her mother came from the Kiyohara clan.
sen.cmt: Combined this sentence with the one below to reduce sentence fragmentation
sen.e: Her father was Masachika URABE and her mother came from the Kiyohara clan.

sen.j: 源信 (僧侶)・願西尼の妹。
sen.e: She was younger sister of Genshin (monk) and Gansaini.
She was the younger sister of her brother Genshin (a Buddhist monk) and sister Gansaini.
sen.cmt: added "brother" and "sister" for clarification; fixed grammar
sen.e: She was the younger sister of her brother Genshin (a Buddhist priest) and sister Gansaini.
sen.cmt: monk を priest に修正しました。

sen.e: She was also called Anyoni.
She was also called Anyoni.
She was also called "Anyoni."
sen.cmt: Anyoni にダブルクォーテーションを追記しました。

sen.j: また、姉の願西尼と同一人物とする説もある。
sen.e: And, there is a view that she was the same person as Gansaini.
There is also a theory that she and Gansaini were the same person.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar for clarity; eliminated "And" at the beginning of the sentence
sen.e: There is also a theory that she and Gansaini were the same person.

sen.j: 幼少から仏道に志し、出家後は大和国吉野山に住んで日夜念仏に専念し、毎月8日に地蔵講を行ったという。
sen.e: It is understood that from her early days, she was determined to go into Buddhism and after she became a nun, she lived in Mt. Yoshino, Yamato Province, where she devoted herself to pray to Amida Buddha and observed Jizoko (the memorial day of Jizo) on the eighth day of every month.

It is claimed that Ganshoni was determined to pursue Buddhism from her childhood, and once becoming a nun, she lived in Mt. Yoshino, Yamato Province, where she devoted herself to praying to the Amida Buddha and observed Jizoko (the memorial day of Jizo) on the eighth day of every month.
sen.cmt: understood→claimed; fixed grammar to have less commas and more natural flow
sen.e: It is claimed that Ganshoni was determined to pursue Buddhism from her childhood, and once becoming a nun, she lived in Mt. Yoshino, Yamato Province, where she devoted herself to praying to the Amida Buddha and performed Jizoko (a Buddhist ritual praising the Jizo (Ksitigarbha)) on the eighth day of every month.
sen.cmt: 「地蔵講 を行った」observed Jizoko (the memorial day of Jizo) をperformed Jizoko (a Buddhist ritual praising the Jizo (Ksitigarbha)) に修正しました。※「地蔵講」について用語集ではJizoko (the memorial day of Jizo) となっていますが、「地蔵菩薩の功徳をたたえ、信者が集まっていとなむ法会(ほうえ)」のことです。http://www.weblio.jp/content/%E5%9C%B0%E8%94%B5%E8%AC%9Bまた、「講」とは「講式」の別名で、仏徳を説明して讃談する声楽の一つで、地蔵講もその一つです。http://books.google.co.jp/books?id=cm43AAAAIAAJ&pg=PA188&dq=Jizo-ko+memorial&lr=&as_brr=3&cd=1#v=onepage&q=Jizo-ko%20memorial&f=falseよって、「地蔵の記念日を祝った」よりも「地蔵（Ksitigarbha）を称える仏教儀式（法会）を行った」という意味で"performed a Buddhist ritual praising the Jizo (Ksitigarbha)" の方が適訳かと思われます。

sen.j: また、西に向かって端座したまま入滅したという。
sen.e: And, she reportedly died keeping herself sitting straight to the west.
Allegedly she died sitting upright and facing to the west.
sen.cmt: fixed grammar to sound more natural
sen.e: Allegedly she died sitting upright and facing to the west.
